com.nequissimus.university.k1584.ui

Class PetriUiImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nequissimus.university.k1584.ui.PetriUiImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PetriUi

    public final class PetriUiImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements PetriUi
    Main class that holds all information and provides all necessary methods for working with the Petri net UI.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Add an arrow to the UI.

      Add a new transition to the UI with a given name.
      java.awt.Dimension calculateCanvasSize(java.awt.Dimension minimum)
      Calculate a new canvas size.
      Canvas sizes are calculated in 500px increments and always square.
      If the given minimum size was (1600, 2100), the calculated size would be (2500, 2500).
      void clean()
      Clean the UI, remove all components.

      Get the main canvas.

      Hide the application window.

      Change a transition's UI whether it is active or not.
      void moveLabel(AbstractLabel label, java.awt.Point location)
      Move a label component to a new location.
      void redrawCanvas()
      Redraw the canvas.
      This method should take care of the entire process, not just call Component.repaint().
      void removeArrow(Arrow arrow)
      Remove an arrow from the UI.
      void removeLabel(AbstractLabel label)
      Remove a label component representing a Petri object.
      void reportMessage(javax.print.attribute.standard.Severity severity, java.lang.String message)
      Report a message to the user by opening an appropriate dialog.
      void resizeArrowCanvas(java.awt.Dimension size)
      Resize all the arrow components' canvases.
      boolean resizeCanvas(java.awt.Dimension size)
      Resize the editor canvas to a new size.
      The canvas can only be resized to a size larger than its Component.getPreferredSize(), so that its components will be visible after resizing.
      boolean resizeCanvas(int difference)
      Resize the canvas by a certain amount of pixels in each direction.

      Set the canvas to a new size.

      • calculateCanvasSize

        public java.awt.Dimension calculateCanvasSize(java.awt.Dimension minimum)
        Description copied from interface: PetriUi
        Calculate a new canvas size.
        Canvas sizes are calculated in 500px increments and always square.
        If the given minimum size was (1600, 2100), the calculated size would be (2500, 2500). If the minimum was (1600, 1600), the result would be (2000, 2000).
        Specified by:
        calculateCanvasSize in interface PetriUi
        Parameters:
        minimum - Minimum canvas size
        Returns:
        New canvas size
